Uses of Class
geometries.Container

Packages that use Container
Package Description
geometries  

  • Uses of Container in geometries

    Subclasses of Container in geometries
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  Cylinder
    this class represents a Cylinder in the space - kind of long tube.
    class  FlatGeometry
    this class represents all kinds of flat shapes - plane, polygon, triangle
    class  Geometries
    this class represents a group of shapes in the space that represent a picture.
    class  Geometry
    interface for all shapes in the space, objects with material and emission fields, and getNormal method (and has the possibility to be intersected)
    class  Plane
    Class Plane is 2D basic object in geometry which represented by two vectors which come from the same point and have different directions (together reflecting the basic 2D object.)
    class  Polygon
    Polygon class represents two-dimensional polygon in 3D Cartesian coordinate system
    class  RadialGeometry
    this class represents all kinds of radial shapes - sphere, tube, cylinder contains the radius for the shape
    class  Sphere
    this class represents a sphere in the space, containing the center point of the sphere and its radius.
    class  Triangle
    this class represents a triangle in the space, containing 3 points (in the polygon vertices list)
    class  Tube
    Class Tube represent a smooth infinite surface, curvature at every point on its face fixed.
    Methods in geometries with parameters of type Container
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void Geometries.add​(Container... geometries)
    a method that receive one or more shape and adds to this list.
    Geometries Geometries.remove​(Container... geometries)
    remove method allow to remove (even zero) geometries from the composite class
    Constructors in geometries with parameters of type Container
    Constructor Description
    Geometries​(Container... geometries)
    constructor of class, creats the list and for now it is empty.
